name: Castle Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms: clean, TV, AC, 2 double beds, bathroom. Quiet. Rooms were okay, nothing fancy, just a good place to relax and sleep.
reviews.title: Nice place, good location

reviews.text: Service: When we first arrived the man who greeted us seemed a bit grumpy or something, but when we came back downstairs to ask him some questions he was more than happy to help us out. He got a tourist map and drew where we should go and not go. :P This helped us out, he was very helpful and made sure we had all the info.
reviews.title: Noisy ! Noisy! Noisy !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: Great, right downtown, parking was included, they had underground (well under building) parking, so we parked the car and walked around downtown for awhile. Close to the buses.
reviews.title: Nice location, so, so hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No complaints whatsoever!
reviews.title: Execellent value for money and good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the return journey from holidaying in New Zealand had booked this MOTEL - certainly NOT a hotel for 4 nights.We booked it from the U.K on Venere where it was described as quiet .Fooled again.Why do I still believe what is stated ? It is on the very busy Broadway Street on an intersection with Van Ness which is a major motorway link.When we arrived I was horrified to see its location.I spoke to the guy at reception who stated the room was quiet.Maybe he should try sleeping there and not be so economical with the truth.The traffic noise was constant.Even through the night there was little relief.In the morning , even though checkout was at 11a.m. the cleaners would start early and slam around.Yes , I could have tried for another hotel but time was precious and I tried to suffer the noise .I have been to SFO twice before , a beautiful city . I stayed at the YMCA on those occasions and although still in a busy area , it was quiet enough to sleep.
reviews.title: Guaranteed Free Parking, really walking distance to fisherman's wharf!

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Castle Inn from 8/28 to 9/1, and found this place perfect in every way. Staff was always there with advice and tips, the room was exceptionally clean, and the location couldn't have been better! We will definitely return here on ou next visit to San Francisco!!
reviews.title: Loved the Castle Inn!!!

reviews.text: Pay close attention in the first five minutes of your visit as your host will give you all the information you need for a safe and enjoyable trip to San Fransisco. The local chamber of commerce should put this on DVD and send it to all prospective visitors. It made our siteseeing so easy as visitors from the UK. Hotel ideally positioned, room clean, all you could want for a visit - will recommend without hesitation
reviews.title: Pay Close Attention
Helpful friendly staff
reviews.text: We found this hotel to have a safe, good location. Staff are polite, interested in your trip and very helpful. The room was basic, but comfortable. We had a microwave and an iron and coffee making facilities. You can help yourself to coffee, tea, hot chocolate in the office at any time. The room was clean , although one thing was that it smelt like some sort of chemical or cleaning agent, which was quite overpowering.
We had a lovely stay at the castle inn. Parking is adeqaute, but san fransisco is so compact anyway. Breakfast was ok...muffins, pastries etc in reception. Staff were wonderful and helpful!!
reviews.title: An Experience that is Difficult to Explain

reviews.text: My wife and I visited SF for the first time and stayed at the Castle Inn ("CI") for three nights. My initial impression at check in was that maybe we had selected accomodations that ran contrary to our tastes and preferences. We do not have any children and stay mostly at four-star hotels/resorts when we travel. In contrast, the CI is an older motel that has outward facing rooms.
reviews.title: Save your money for a real san francisco experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in Castle Inn, SF in Sep. 2007 for 2 nights. I read many reviews of Tripadvisor and booked directly with the hotel. My expectation was so high after leaning about the hotel from Tripadvisor reviews, but must say, "Not Worth for Money"... The best thing of this hotel was the super helpful staff. What I disliked at this accomodation were; the really not nice breakfast, the expencive price, the poor water pressured shower and the uncomfy beds. I'm not quite sure why people on Tripadvisor have given "Excellent" to this hotel... To me, it was just OK. I did stay in two other hotels this time in SF; Baldwin Hotel on Grant street (Perfect location, can't even compare with Castle Inn) and Mayflower Hotel on Bush (another great location with an delicious Italian restaurant near by). Both offer much cheaper rates of rooms and great service and rooms. Mayflower gives you a good sized breakfast too. One thing, though, those two don't have free parking spaces for you. If I ever go back to the city, Id definitely consider those two, not, Castle Inn, which everyone here in Tripadvisor seems to be very impressed...
reviews.title: Not Worth for Money...
Excellent location, helpful staff
reviews.text: I didn't have high hopes for the Castle Inn, we booked it at the last minute prior to a long road trip, but boy was I proved wrong.

The rooms are pretty standard, but are clean and comfortable, but the hotel's location, close to Polk Street/Broadway is an ideal location as it's out of the main tourist areas, but close to many great restaurants and bars that the locals go to, so you can experience the real San Francisco.
reviews.title: Very Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also the girl at reception, sorry I've forgotten your name, was very very helpful, within 5 minutes of arriving she had given us a map and marked on it the best places to go (and the places to avoid) and continued to be helpful, giving excellent restaurant and bar recommendations, all within walking distance.
reviews.title: Perfect stay at The Castle Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I go back to San Francisco, i'll definately go here.
reviews.title: Loved Castle Inn

reviews.text: I had never traveled to or driven in San Francisco prior to our trip in June, 2005. I have two young children and I was nervous about safety, cleanliness, location, ability to maneuver around the city, etc. Varsa immediately puts you at ease. My concerns started to melt away during my conversation with her. She explained bus routes, noticed our young children and marked out areas of San Francisco on the map she said were not for kids, helped us with directions, etc. I, like many of the previous reviewers went with the Castle Inn because of excellent internet reviews and they are accurate. Hotel is clean, located in a safe neighborhood, guarantees you a free parking space (rare in San Francisco), refridgerator and microwave a plus, easy busride/walk to wharf, Ghiradelli Square, China Town.....all at a very reasonable price for San Francisco. All this is excellent but Varsa is the best thing about the Castle Inn. This is the only hotel I have ever reviewed on the internet. I felt compelled to review this one though and give it an excellent rating. This is where we will stay if and when we find ourselves in San Francisco again.
reviews.title: Friendly, Comfortable, Reassuring and Safe
Taste of San Francisco living.
reviews.text: This is a great economical base for touring SF. We booked two rooms for three nights based on the glowing recommendations on this web site and were not disappointed.

reviews.title: Very Satisfied!!!
reviews.text: Hotel location is perfect. Easy walking distance to Ghiardelli Sq, but a little tougher (hills) to Fishermans Wharf, Pier 39, Chinatown, North Beach and Lombard St. Climb the hill and take the cable car to Union Sq.

reviews.title: A hidden gem in San Fran
reviews.text: What I really liked was the neighborhood atmosphere. It gave a taste of what draws people to live in SF - a variety of great neighborhood restaurants around the corner on Polk St or Union St (try the Little Thai two doors down). Stroll around the corner in the morning and browse the bageleries, boulangeries, coffee shops and tea houses for breakfast - up and comming without being too chi-chi. Felt safe even late at night.

I checked out some of the other hotels we were considering and was glad we stayed at the the Castle - the Cow Hollow motels are too far away and the Union Sq area is too busy and grimy - and twice the price. The Castle is quiet enough to sleep with the windows open and free come-and-go parking makes this the best deal in SF.
reviews.title: Love Versa!

reviews.text: We stayed few days but we were able to appreciate the comfort of the room and the good location. The room was very clean with brand new furnitures and bathroom. No panoramas from the rooms. Lifter present and working. Small take-away breakfast. Nice guys at the reception.
reviews.title: excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Castle Inn for 2 nights during our 3 week road trip. We were not interested in fancy locations and were interested in a place to clean up, sleep and not having to pay for parking (that's why I can't stand Chicago). Along with these requirements we wanted a place with easy access to the wharf and transportation. Castle Inn fit these requirements perfectly. Our room was clean, the owner was very friendly and helpful with directions, suggestions on places to eat and places to avoid. He even gave me his parking space near the elevator. We had requested a room away from the street and received the end room on the top floor which worked well. If you're looking for something that fits the description I have provided, this is the place. We would stay there again. Also, as a side not, if heading North out of the city, access to the Golden gate bridge route is real easy from here.
reviews.title: Interested in seeing the city not fancy rooms to sleep!
Save on room, spend savings on having fun & relaxing
reviews.text: If you are wanting a 5 star hotel, do not read any further. If you are wanting an affordable clean, conveniet 2 star hotel, continue reading.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PARKING: One of San Francisco's high expense. The parking spaces are "tight" but FREE!! We had a feeling of safety for us, the garage and our car.
reviews.title: Awesome experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: LOCATION: Located centrally - Broadway & Van Ness or Polk St. 2 1/2 "uphill blocks to the cable car. (We took a bus and transferred over to cable car). Catching one is "uphill" but comng home when you are tired is all "downhill" when you need your energy. Less than l/2 block to a bus stop.
reviews.title: The Best Deal of Our Vacation
I will always stay here while in San Fran
reviews.text: This hotel was amazing. Before I even got there I wanted to write a grand review. Varsa handled my reservation and was also on duty for the 3 nights me and my boyfriend stayed there, and she was extremely helpful from the first time I called to the time of checkout. We did not experience any problems while there. In fact, on the first day we returned to our room and the cleaning staff had left our window open to air the room out (screen was closed, though), so we went to the front desk to request that they not do this (just our own preference), and it was immediately put on the cleaning staff list of special instructions. Needless to say, the window was never left open again. The accommodations were perfect. If you're expecting rose petals in your bathroom and a foot massage with bon bons upon awakening, you a) may be spending too much time in your room anyway, but b) should look elsewhere, because these accommodations are great for people who want a good, safe, convenient location with good service (the fridge and microwave were a definite plus). If you're looking for the latter, then book here. The free parking was EXCELLENT. Buyer beware - if you think you're getting a "bargain" at some of the other hotels which do not have free parking, think again. You could pay upwards of $25+ per day for parking alone, and even more if they don't grant you in-and-out access during the day. Do the math and in most cases you'll probably come out dollars ahead if you stay here instead. There were some great restaurants in the area (Aroma Cafe and the Bagelry are worth special mention...and you MUST go to Firefly which is all the way across town but well worth it), as well as a Walgreens literally just around the corner (at the time of this review) in case you forgot something. For those who might be a little swayed by the one unsatisfied reviewer who complained that this hotel isn't as close to the Wharf as advertised, I'd say this -- downtown San Fran is not like Manhattan...it's pretty small and everything is fairly easy to get to. It took us about 20 min by cable car, including the walk from the hotel to the stop and the trip down to the wharf. Plus you get some great photo ops (including Lombard's one crooked block) that way! And in terms of being told to hold it down, the sign for quiet hours is clearly posted...I'd want a hotel manager to do the same thing if there were guests disturbing my sleep even if they didn't mean to. Again, this hotel was fabulous. Thanks to Varsha and Sy for a wonderful experience. I'll be back whenever I come to San Fran next, and will gladly recommend you to everyone I know!

reviews.title: Excellent value
reviews.text: We stayed at the Castle Inn for 6 nights in May and found that it was worthy of the good reviews we had seen on this site. Marshall, Arlene and Varsa were very friendly and helpful with suggestions and advice. The street map they gave us was very handy and helped us find our way around the city. The room was spotlessly clean and the beds were exceptionally comfortable. Our shower was really powerful and there was everything we needed in the room, fridge/freezer, iron and ironing board and microwave oven. Our room was one of the farthest away from the road and we weren't disturbed by traffic noise at all. The area was very convenient and we were able to walk to Fisherman's Wharf, (downhill all the way there, but not too bad on the way back) and Chinatown (steep hill but worth it for the view, or you can go through the tunnel instead).

reviews.title: Absolutely recommend
reviews.text: The breakfast was adequate for us and there are plenty of restaurants and shops nearby if you need more.

If you don't need luxury you will find everything you need here with the bonus of having staff who make you welcome and will take time to answer your questions, advise and help you. It's also fantastic value, especially if you have a car as the parking is free.
reviews.title: Perfect Accommodation
A great place to stay!
reviews.text: I absolutely recommend the Castle Inn.

reviews.title: Castle Inn - a little gem
reviews.text: We were encouraged by Tripadvisor reviews and not disappointed. The room was spacious, clean and well-equipped. The location was very convenient. The staff were young, efficient and pleasant but the real advantage of this hotel is the owners whose hospitality and local knowledge make you feel as though you are staying as welcome guests. The only disadvantage was that its popularity meant we were unable to stay on for additional nights on the spur of the moment. We would definitely return.
Basic, clean, friendly hotel in a great spot. Staff was very helpful, most major bus lines run near it and it was affordable. I'd stay there again.
reviews.title: Great location, Good Value

reviews.text: The Castle Inn is our favorite small hotel in San Francisco! We have stayed there on 2 occasions & the wonderful staff, convenient location, & clean, quiet rooms keep us coming back!
reviews.title: Quiet, Clean, Great Value -Best Little Motel in SF!

reviews.text: Located at Broadway & Van Ness, Castle Inn is in a nice neighborhood with drug store, grocery, cafes & cute shops within close walking distance. It's also right on the bus line & is a straight shot down to Fisherman's Wharf. My dad & I stayed for 4 quiet & comfortable nights. We rented a car on our previous trip, but found that with a little planning, getting around on the bus was an easier & less costly option. The Castle Inn does offer free parking though, which is a real bonus in SF! Parking throughout SF is difficult, pricey & hard to find. For this trip, we purchased 3-day Muni Passes at the airport when we arrived, & used those to travel the city on busses & cable cars - a good value if you don't mind the challenges of riding city busses! Make sure you get a bus route map when you purchase your Muni Passes!
reviews.title: Out standing service

reviews.text: Rooms at the Castle are clean & comfortable - not fancy or large, but decent & reasonably priced compared to many SF hotels. Our 2-bed room had a hairdryer, small fridge, coffee maker, free cable tv & table with 2 large chairs. Our 3rd floor room overlooked a lovely yard of trees next door & we could just see a bit of the Golden Gate Bridge in the distance. There is a nice little continental breakfast (coffee, cocoa, yogurt, fruit, pastries, granola bars) in the lobby. The best feature of the Castle Inn is our favorite hostess, Versa! She is always so pleasant, accomodating & knowledgeable with good advice about the city. They also gave us a chart showing busses/stop locations to go to various tourist locations throughout the city. Castle Inn also has a nice website worth checking out.
reviews.title: Castle Inn great value

reviews.text: Arrived at 11.30pm by taxi after a tiring 12-hour flight and expected to be dealing with a dumb night -porter. Cheered up no end by Marshal's friendly briefing on what to see & where to go during vacation and for his advice during the 6 nights my wife & I stayed. The neighborhood is very safe and offers good food (American, Asian, Italian), bars, bookshops, Walgreens, and coffee shops. Buy a MUNI pass-- you can pick up a bus or cable car going almost anywhere in SF from a stop near the hotel. The room had all that was required and very quite. Light buffet breakfast in lobby or coffee shops nearby. Next time in San Francisco, this is the hotel for me.
reviews.title: Close to Central

likes.liked: — So close (10 minutes) from tourist scene

reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights at the end of our weeklong road trip along the Pacific Coast Highway starting in LA. The location is excellent. Parking is free (beware of what other hotels charge for this). Once we arrived, we parked the rental and didn't move it again until we left. This hotel is right near bus routes 47 and 49 and not that far from the starting point of the California Cable Car Line (California and Van Ness). If you ride the cable cars and buses a few times each in a given day, buy the all-you-can-ride day pass. Varsa (owner) was very helpful on the phone when I made the reservation. She wasn't there when we stayed, (would have liked to chat with her in person), but the husband and wife team working helped us with restaurants, maps, where to avoid, where best to catch the cable cars, etc. The room is decent size for the city. It was fairly quiet, and very clean. The elevator worked well. It was nice having a fridge since we were leaving early for the airport on our 2nd day. I'd recommend stocking up on food from the Real Food organic market just around the corner on Polk St (kinda pricey, but aren't most organic markets). Breakfast at this hotel was skimpy but I never expect much from continental breakfast. Good coffee could also be had around the corner on Polk at the Royal Ground, and 1/2 way decent bagels at the San Francisco Bagelry (Polk as well). The 20 something crowd would like the proximity of this hotel to the bars. Perhaps not as ideal for families with younger kids (no pool, no green space to run around), but this is an urban area after all.
reviews.title: A solid choice with very good location
Perfect place to stay!
reviews.text: Found the hotel in the AAA book. Found the web site user friendly, and glad I booked Castle Inn. Best price in the area, free parking, and helpful office management. Good neighborhood, close to all. Our family of 4 were very comfortable. We drove everywhere, but there is public transportation nearby. Would definitely stay here again!

Yes, it is a fantastic deal. Good location. Parking. Outstanding price. Helpful staff. Very clean, fresh-smelling room. Frig and microwave. Many nice touches. Good restaurants and interesting shops nearby. Will definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Yes, it's all true

reviews.text: My family of 6 (2 adults & 4 children) stayed at the Castle Inn last week for 3 nights. We simply cannot fault this hotel in any way. Great location (good local restaurants and very close to public transport), extremely spacious, clean, and Varsa (the Manager) is a total gem - she was happy to help with any query or question we threw her way.
reviews.title: look no further
Honeymoon Highlight
reviews.text: We arrived late on Tuesday June 20th and stayed 3 nights at the beginning of our 8 night, 7 day honeymoon to San Francisco and Sonoma Valley. Sy met us at about midnight and immediately began providing extremely useful information. Varsa was just as helpful the next day. They provided us with a "cheat sheet" of directions to all the key tourist sites and provided us with excellent restaurant recommendations within the area that were not tourist traps. We tried 3 of them and were very pleased. Tai Chi (Polk and Broadway) was a Hunan Mandarin restaurant that was out of this world. Hyde Street Seafood House was incredible for (wait for it -) seafood. Street on Polk has wonderful ambience. $2 Happy Hour (Thursdays and Fridays 5 to 9 p.m.) at Rouge (Polk and Broadway) was great too. The Polk Street/Russian Hill area is an incredible district. Castle Inn is right in the middle of it and within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, Lombard Street (the Crooked Street), Nob Hill and North Beach.

reviews.title: Loved this place!
reviews.text: The hotel is great value for money. The room was one of the cleanest we have ever stayed in and was very quiet (we were near the back of the hotel). We greatly appreciated the amazing personal concierge service from Sy and Varsa! We highly recommend this hotel.

I recently traveled to SF and stayed at the Castle Inn for 5 nights. The owners, Varsa and Sy, were very friendly and helped with ideas and directions. The rooms were very nice...a good room for the price! I also found the rooms to be very clean and quiet...my room was towards the rear of the hotel, so I am sure that it helped keep the noise level down. Parking was never a problem and a great bargin....it was free! If your plans don't take you out of SF, you really wouldn't need to rent a car. The Castle Inn is located in the perfect spot. Easy walk to the wharf, chinatown, north beach...union square was a bit farther, but still a nice walk. There are many restaurants located on Polk Street. On my next visit to SF, I will be staying at the Castle Inn!
reviews.title: Good place for those on a budget

reviews.text: I just got back from my round-the-world holiday so I thought I'd submit a review on the Castle Inn. I stayed there in April with my girlfriend.
reviews.title: Don't pass this place up

reviews.text: On arrival it's one of those places where you're thinking "oh dear, what did I book?"
reviews.title: Great Hotel, great Service and close to Fisherman's Wharf

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Trip Advisor reader comments is what convinced my wife & I to stay at THE CASTLE INN. I was skeptical of all of the great comments... thought they were too good to be true...but they were true. As soon as you walked out of the office after checking in, you just knew the hotel would live up to the reviews.
reviews.title: It Gets My Best Rating

reviews.text: IN A NUTSHELL, STAY HERE! It just doesn't get any better unless you want to drop a few hundred $ per night.
reviews.title: Good Room, Wonderful Staff, Amazing Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We liked it so well, I am compelled to write this to help other first timers to San Francisco, as we were.
reviews.title: Great location, very friendly

likes.liked: — Plenty of space, good value, clean, nice location

reviews.text: My wife & both enjoyed everything...here are the highlights for you;
reviews.title: Delightful 5 night stay

likes.liked: — Room rate, location to public transit, room size and cleanliness

reviews.text: HOTEL; clean, great value, on site parking so you can access your car easily, modest but sufficient breakfast...enough to get you out & on your way, clean sheets/towels daily of good quality, cleaned the bathroom daily (cleaned it, not just wipe off the counter) hotel is small'ish which makes it easy to get around.
reviews.title: A practical San Francisco gem

reviews.text: We just returned from six nights at the Castle, and it lived up to all the positive reviews that it received on Trip Advisor. Although it doesn't look like much at first glance, the rooms are very nice, well equipped, and clean. The neighborhood is also quite pleasant, with good dining and shopping nearby. The people who work there are extremely helpful. They really go out of their way to make sure your San Francisco experience is enjoyable.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.text: we stayed 3 nights at the castle inn, and we found it very friendly easy to get to the attractions and parking was very good we could not fault this place very clean also and everyone was very helpfull, we would certainly use this hotel if we was in san fran again we recomend it.
reviews.title: lovely place to stay

reviews.text: It is hard to come up with something original so I won't try. We stayed at the Castle Inn for 3 nights in August and would highly recommend it. At first I had thought of staying around Union Square or Fisherman's Wharf. I am so glad that we didn't, we saved money as those hotels were much more expensive and ended up staying in a great neighbourhood rather than a tourist area. We loved Polk Street it had everything with atmosphere thrown in. Versa who was the only person we met ,was very pleasant and helpful. The rooms were comfortable. We didn't use the breakfast facility, it would not suit everyone but will suit a lot of people. Just diagnally across the road was a great diner where we enjoyed breakfast, another day we went to down to the bay.
reviews.title: Like everyone else we really liked this hotel
Top marks!
reviews.text: The hotel is nothing flash to look at but shines where it matters most. The Castle Inn deserves all the accolades it gets, I think their secret is making you feel like they care.

This hotel is fantastic - it is in a safe, quiet location with free parking, it is near the cable car, the family suite is absolutely huge, and the staff (particularly Varsa) are very welcoming and extremely helpful. Breakfast is small but perfectly adequate (yoghurt, fruit, pastries, coffee and juice). I can't think of anything we were unhappy with. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Great place to stay
Lives Up To Its Reputation
reviews.text: We chose Castle Inn for our three night stay in San Francisco based on the excellent reviews on tripadvisor.com. I am happy to report that the positive reviews are right on the money. We actually arrived two hours prior to check in time and were given a room right away. We stayed in #339, which is the last room on the top floor. Very quiet since no other guests walk by the room. Parking was always available. Check in and out went extremely smoothly. Owners and staff were knowledgeable and very friendly. Our room was basic, similar to La Quinta, but was very clean and had everything we needed. The location was ideal for visiting all the tourist spots, and there is a Starbucks right around the corner on Polk. We rode the cable car/bus one day and drove the next day. We much preferred having our car and did not have difficulty finding parking. We paid about the same for two all day bus passes as we did for parking the next day. We highly recommend Castle Inn! The total cost was approximately half of staying at the better known chains.

Agree heartily with many of the other reviewers of the Castle. It's a great value spot in San Francisco. Not fancy but clean, comfortable beds, free parking, well located and good service by the owners.
reviews.title: Great Value in San Fran
Great Place for A Great Price
reviews.text: Please ask the proprietors for restaurant advice. We ate at three of their recommendations (Chinese, Mexican and burgers) in the neighborhood and had great food at very reasonable prices. Much better quality and value than the places down by the Wharf.

Strongly recommend buying the public transportation pass. We did the three day pass and you can use the trains, buses or cable cars. Saves alot of time and energy instead of battling SF's famous hills. And don't wait in the often long lines at the beginning of the cable car routes. Walk up a stop and grab a spot - they don't fill the cars to capacity at the origin.
reviews.title: Terrific hotel for families
Castle Inn
reviews.text: My wife and I planned our first trip to San Francisco and Napa valley and used TripAdvisor as one of our main research tools. We opted to stay at the Castle Inn after reading numerous reviews and checking out prices. All I can say is that our visit lived up to our expectations. The Castle Inn was clean and centrally located to many of the attractions we were interested in visiting.

We stayed at the Castle Inn from 7/27 thru 7/31. We chose this hotel because of all the great reviews on Trip Advisor along with the reasonable price and convenient location. We had traveling with us my husband’s mother, sister and his nephew and his wife.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: We could not have been more pleased with the hotel. The rooms were roomy and very clean. Added bonus was having the refrigerator and microwave in our room. Everyone was very happy with their room.
reviews.title: Fantastic base for exploring San Francisco
Comfortable & Friendly in a Great Neighborhood
reviews.text: The free parking was a very big plus. We parked and used the bus for most of our San Francisco sightseeing. Buses were only one block over on either side of the hotel. The Wharf, Pier 39 and Ghairdelli square are in walking distance. However, my mother in law is 76 and we used the bus as the hills can be a bit strenuous.

reviews.title: Perfect for the money
reviews.text: Versa in the front office is unbelievable. Very knowledgeable, very helpful and very friendly. She could not do enough for us.
Like a previous poster said-One block away is a Walgreen’s for soda and snacks and there are several great restaurants with in walking distance. Very nice, safe neighborhood.
reviews.title: Lived up to great reviews

reviews.text: We had a wonderful visit to San Francisco thanks to Varsa at the Castle Inn. She not only helped us with planning our sight seeing itinerary but also took care of all of our bookings. Her vibrant personality, coupled with the great location of this hotel, made our stay an enjoyable one. If you are planning a trip to San Francisco, the Castle Inn is definitely the place to stay.
reviews.title: Loved the Castle Inn

reviews.text: Stayed 4 nights at the beginning of our holiday, luggage was stored whilst we did a trip to Yosemite and then back for another 3 nights. Marshall and Arlene do a wonderful job. The area is great, transport via the Muni system is so easy and Polk Street was a great eating area. Walking to fishermans Wharf is quite easy as well as it is DOWNHILL. Supplied us with a transport guide to main attractions/ bus numbers as well as various recommendations. Fresh fruit, yoghurt some muffins can be chosen for breakfast Microwave coffee maker and fridge was very useful. Rooms very very clean building recently painted. Congratulations and thanks.
reviews.title: Aussies recommend Castle Inn and area great value

reviews.text: While looking through the hotel reviews on this site for our first trip to San Francisco, my husband and I came across Castle Inn. We put our trust in what others had to say and are happy to report that the Castle Inn lived up to all our expectations! The staff is very helpful and friendly, the rooms are clean and had everything that we needed. It was so handy to have a microwave and refrigerator! The continental breakfast was convenient and provided just enough to get us going. The Inn is close to so many tourist sites and restaurants (Thai, Mexican, Pizza, Starbucks and more) and is very close to several bus routes. There is a Walgreens right down the street which we found very handy to have by. If we were to travel to San Fran again, we would absolutely book another stay at the Castle Inn.
reviews.title: Lived up to our expectations!

reviews.text: as per other guests who have enjoyed their stay at the castle, we did too.
reviews.title: another good review

reviews.text: room on the third floor was very clean and well maintaied. my wife is very particular about beds and clean sheets. and these were immaculate, even though marshall told us they were having problems with the laundry.
reviews.title: Ideal place tp stay

reviews.text: When we arrived I was a bit disappointed, not sure what I was expecting but all the rooms face down into a courtyard. Someone else described it more motor inn than motel/hotel & I would have to agree. Obvious plus, they don't charge extra for parking your car there like many other hotels. The staff is extremely friendly, well informed & more than willing to help you anyway they can. The room was very clean and roomy except for the bathroom area. The bathroom is the size of a closet and I'm not a big person & nowhere to put anything once inside. The sink is outside but not much room there either. It's a solid 15 min. walk downhill to the Wharf & that's the beginning of the Wharf, it will take you another 10 mins. to walk, let's say to the pier for Alcatraz - it's pretty much all uphill back - best to take the bus or trolly - both leave you near the hotel. I'd skip the continental breakfast, nothing special, some fruit, no fresh muffins - packaged stuff - would have been nice to have some real milk or cream for coffee/tea as opposed to powdered. The price was right for what you get.
reviews.title: It's ok

reviews.text: We stayed at the Castle Inn for 5 nights and found the place to be exactly as others had described. The staff were very helpful and friendly and the location was great for exploring the city. Room was comfortable and the breakfast although only light was really convenient. My only slight criticism is that we found the shower difficult to operate but otherwise our stay was great.
reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff

reviews.text: My tip for other visitors using taxis is make sure that you know the cross street for your destination. The SF taxi drivers don't have the same knowledge as London cabbies. The 2 we used didn't know where the Castle Inn was and even had trouble finding Broadway.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: I agree with the other positive reviews. Great location. Clean and comfortable. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Parking is a great bonus. Would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Stay

likes.liked: — near to everything and excellent staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolutely fab place to stay, so convenient to all that is going on, staff were very helpful with map and directions and a great plus is secure parking. the people in San Francisco were the best, so friendly here. We only stayed 2 nights but would like to stay a week next time. Weather abit cool even for us Brits but go to other side of bridge and its fabulous.
reviews.title: Good Bet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this motel for 3 nights. Good location. Clean big rooms, but a bit old fashioned. Free parking. Simple breakfast. Average service. Good restraints nearby. Good choice for travelers who need place to sleep.
reviews.title: Good location, average rooms and service

reviews.text: If you are looking for a wonderful place to stay, stay here.. The Castle Inn in SF California is wonderful.. The Staff are amazing the rooms are great, clean, and , I am not sure about anyone but I travel with my son so safety is a big thing for me.. THIS PLACE WAS SAFE TOO!!! Great location close enough for a great walk... or to hop a trolley(that was fun).. This place and the wonderful people there should be commended for such a great little home!!(that is what it felt like) This is the Best Kept Secret In San Francisco California. Thanks so much it was wonderful. I cannot wait for my trip back to see you!!!
reviews.title: Truely GREAT!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2 nights in April. Our 2nd visit. Paid $84/nt +tax. Fridge, microwave, internet, free parking and clean, comfy rooms with good shower. We did hear a bit of other room noise but nothing much. What more can you ask for at this price!! Limited dry-goods offered at breakfast but everything you need in walking distance from French Bakeries to bagel shops, and of course Starbucks.
reviews.title: Excellent value, great in-room facs, plenty bars/rest's within walk distance

reviews.text: Our 2nd visit and definitely not our last. Plus, we LOVE that high street feel right outside the door, around the corner on Polk. A great selection of bars and restaurants with a european/eclectic feel. Walk to Wharf about 15 minutes, also Union Street and shops within 10 minutes walk also for a nice change,and even more of a european feel/outside seating.
reviews.title: Nicer treatment than our $225 night room on Nob HIll

reviews.text: Michael and Damon at front desk were both helpful. Thank you again Castle Inn--a great stay. See you next time!
reviews.title: A great place to stay in San Fran!!!!!
Thanks Trip Advisor!
reviews.text: We also stayed at the Castle Inn because of the great reviews on this site, and we weren't disappointed. The room was clean and comfortable, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the parking was free. Our favorite part was the area where the hotel was located. Just down Polk street are a Walgreen's, a Peet's Coffee and Tea, a small local grocery, a quaint local coffee house, and a variety of restaurants. And, it's a short walk to the cable car lines, which will take you to all the sights. This was a great place for us to begin and end our days of touring. If you're looking for a no frills home base on a trip to see the city, the Castle Inn is for you.

reviews.title: Great Service at Castle Inn

reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.text: Location was central and convenient. The neighborhood felt safe at night. The area has many restaurants, a good bookstore, laundromat, drugstore, and natural foods store within walking distance. Parking is tight - be patient if your vehicle is large. The complimentary breakfast is very basic and is available in the front desk area on a small counter - no dining area here. It's enough to get you going for an hour or two. I was surprised how quiet our room was considering the heavy traffic on the streets - we were on the third floor about halfway back. If your trip involves busy days away from your room - this place works as a clean, quiet place to sleep and relax.. If you want a plush room and expect to spend much time in your room, I'd look elsewhere.
reviews.title: Basic & convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here at the end of last year. Staff were amazingly friendly and helpful. Location was great. Easy walking distance to everything. Spot on.
reviews.title: Excellent Location. V. friendly staff

reviews.text: Checked reviews prior to staying at this hotel. Wanted something in city that was resonable. Called hotel when I got into city and got a room for $59.00 plus tax. Very basic room but very clean. 15 minute walk to Fishermans Wharf. Nice neighborhood, felt safe. Lots of restaurants and coffee shops nearby. Had lunch at local restaurant around corner of Hotel called Nicks Taco, Very good lunch! Someone local had recommeded it. Man at desk was helpful and pointed out places to go and areas to stay out of on map. Would definitly come back and stay here
reviews.title: Very resonable

reviews.text: We stayed here because we were travelling on a budget and were very pleased with our choice. Parking is free which is a big plus and the other big plus is It's in a fantastic area of San Fran with the trendy bars, organic supermarket and cafes of Russian Hill just around the corner.
reviews.title: Great value for money in a safe area.

reviews.text: Although the rooms were basic they were clean and comfortable and the staff were very, very helpful. We enjoyed our stay here and spent the money we saved on parking in the lovely cafes around the corner.
reviews.title: Worth the price

reviews.text: We stayed at the Castle Inn for 5 nights in July at the start of our three week tour of California. The booking was made purely on reading the good reviews on this website.
reviews.title: Castle Inn- Highly Recommended
Great value and location!
reviews.text: We arrived at the Castle Inn after a long flight from Belfast via London travelling with our three young boys.

reviews.title: Great Value for money
reviews.text: Marshall and Arlene were very helpful during our checkin and throughout our 5 night stay.
The family suite we got was not fancy, but very spacious, extremely clean and comfortable with separate bedroom, mini fridge, iron and ironing board. The breakfast included was adequate.
reviews.title: Good location - good value

reviews.text: The Castle Inn is situated in a very safe area and within walking distance to all the tourist areas (our youngest is only 5 and he managed the walks).
reviews.title: Good value in San Francisco

reviews.text: I'll join the chorus of praisers of the Castle Inn. Wonderfully pleasant and helpful innkeeper. Great location (fabulous dining within 2 blocks - Polkers for breakfast, Nick's Crispy Tacos for lunch, Habana for diner), great rooms, free parking, wireless Internet. Great value.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.text: We read reviews on this hotel on trip advisor and picked the hotel because of them. I am glad we did! This hotel is fantastic, I am almost afraid to let people know about it, because I want it to remain the same price and have availability next time I go. The location is perfect and we were able to catch a bus or trolley easily to anywhere we were going, just a few blocks away. Great restaurants nearby. Whenever we return we will always stay at this hotel! The owners are great and our 4 year old loved talking to them every day.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: The Castle Inn provides friendly service and a clean, comfortable room for a good price. Parking is free. It is conveniently located to most major attractions. The complimentary breakfast is a bit skimpy but Starbucks is just around the corner.
reviews.title: Castle Inn-very convenient
Great location,great value
reviews.text: Nice clean hotel within walking distance of many attractions in SF. The staff was very helpful with directions, things to see and places to avoid. Free parking a plus, clean rooms however ours was a little noisy from the traffic. Great value, will stay again.

Large, clean, comfortable rooms at a fair price in San Francisco. We were given youth passes to the cable cars for our six and eight year old girls. Breakfast was plain and there's no public area to speak of. Water leaked from under the seal on the sliding shower door. This hotel is convenient to reach in city traffic if you are driving and the free parking is a reason to choose this over other budget options (Chancellor in Union Square was ours). I did not find parking a Chrysler mini-van at all difficult at Castle Inn, although others report a different experience. Housekeeping was very good. A bonus in the area for those with kids is Helen Wills park, an urban park about a block away. The activities director patiently showed the girls how to make a lanyard, even though we arrived well after 6 p.m. to play.
reviews.title: You'll Like It

description: Described by guests as "the ideal place to stay in San Francisco," Castle Inn offers beautiful rooms, a fantastic location, and wonderful, friendly service. With FREE PARKING, FREE wireless internet access, in-room coffee, cable TV with HBO, hairdryers, iron/boards, mini-fridge/freezers, microwaves, a/c, and mini-breakfast, you have all of the comforts of home. Perfectly situated for your SF visit, we are within walking distance to Fisherman?s Wharf, Chinatown, Cable Cars, Crookedest Street, and more!
